name: ringgit
content:

the standard unit of money used in Malaysia: Oil royalties worth 810m ringgit were due to be paid this year by the national oil company. On October 1st, the ringgit fell 4% in a day, making it 25% cheaper against the dollar than it was in early July.
More examplesFewer examplesThe animal was to be paid for in ringgits, the local currency.Official figures showed that commodity export earnings, including petroleum, rose from 28,910 million ringgits in 1988 to about 30,000 million ringgits in 1989.The measures include mandatory jail sentences of between one and twenty years and fines of up to 500,000 ringgit.
